name: cbtbone
text: Denise

name: greyfield
text: Denise is in hell.

name: fattypneumonia
text: Chubby for a chubby........ Denise

name: jstegall
text:
DENISE! ARE YOU CRAPPIN'?
That's poetry to my ears.

name: rosie
text: Beef's prodigious beer gut, male pattern baldness, and aviators are terrifying. He is obviously knocking on the cheap plywood door of a trailer bathroom.

name: sakana
text: Beef has way too many issues and circumstances to ever be normal like that.

name: professorhazard
text: The fundamental problem with this scenario is that in reality, Denise would not be crappin' with the door closed. Unless it was Thanksgiving.

name: wfl
text: And if it were Thanksgiving, it would be unnecessary to feed the dog, since it would eat at the table like all the other people who let their bozzack hang out all loose after overstuffing on dry 2 day old 7-11 turkey and.. well, you get the idea.

name: greenkoolayd
text: turkey from 7-11=what a fool believes.

name: dusty
text: He knows they don't have turkey, "7-11 turkey" is just a street term for when you jack the whole rotisserie spindle full of hot dogs.

name: soticoto
text: Gotta be better than road-turkey though.

name: hipjiverobot
text: The fundamental problem with this scenario is that a family of cats owns a dog. This would be comparable to a family of humans owning a gorilla, an improbable situation regardless of the holiday.

name: hipjiverobot
text: Now that I think about it, there probably exists a movie in the style of Air Bud where a family mistakenly receives a gorilla for Christmas and befriends it. Humor ensues!

name: fresco
text: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0116151/

name: tollschaft
text: Why am i the only person who has chubbed you? YOU DESERVE CHUBBS FOR YOUR FINDINGS DAMNIT

name: soticoto
text: ... Cats own humans though. Surely that is even more improbable.

name: jamers
text: I wish Friendly's had Burger Baskets.

name: rowboat
text: Friendly's is where I drink. They pour beer down me.

name: quantumcasaba
text: Yaaay!

name: blarghamagarky
text: WHAT THEY DON'T EVEN SERVE BEER EVER!

name: rowboat
text: The Friendly's I know is not depicted in this strip.

name: blarghamagarky
text: wow ok yea that changes the value of some childhood memories/free birthday sundaes for me a lot

name: rowboat
text: Someone said on an earlier strip that they serve ice cream out of clowns' heads, or something. Did you ever see any nightmarish, hateful shit like that going down at your so-called "Friendly's?"

name: blarghamagarky
text: um a fucking cone head sundae

name: rowboat
text: A fucking cone head sundae? Like Saturday Night Live cone head? I'm so confused. And fearful.

name: blarghamagarky
text:
from friendly's website, for you, rowboat.

[IMGS OFF]

They hide more reeses pieces in the bottom as a surprise for you.

name: rowboat
text:
Thank you, blarghamagarky. Thank you for assuaging the fevered dreams which have lived in my head for the last few weeks.

Now it's time for thoughts of me to torture this little guy, 'cause if I ever find one of these Friendly's restaurants, it's gonna be a bloodbath! A sugary, delicious bloodbath!

name: blarghamagarky
text: I used to get six kinds of crazy on them when I was little, that was like my favorite shit ever. Only it would be mint chocolate chip ice cream.

name: canusdivinus
text: Chubbied for impeccable ice cream choice.

name: johnnybaverage
text: I loved those things as a kid. Hell, I wouldn't mind one now. Except for the fact that I would have to go to Friendly's.

name: wehavemagnums
text: I think he's developing a thing for corpulent women...

name: nicolae
text: How do you know?!

name: beansdooma
text: A comment left by beansdooma was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zem, hellofditties, Ikrizzle)

name: donsoze
text: I would say his throughts are like poetry, but the hams aren't some concealed weapon.

name: reaubhat
text: Only Beef would assume that to be his 10 year from now self.

name: hateandwar
text: Man I wish my vision of my future was that positive.

name: chaesar
text:
Denise...your hams...

I am down

name: epicurus
text: The last panel became the standard way of checking if the washroom was occupied at my place.

name: presterjohn
text: I am giving this a chubby because I assume everyone was called Denise regardless of their name.

name: epicurus
text: Just so. In fact 3/4s of us were men.

name: soticoto
text:
Funny. My way of checking if someone is in there usually goes along the lines of:
"... 'Ello Daaaave? ... You want to buy some clothes pegs Dave?"

name: tekende
text: That...that's great?

name: soticoto
text: Not being familiar with League of Gentlemen automatically equates to not getting what I was on about in the slightest.

name: tekende
text: Evidently.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by lawbot, loneal, Doc_Rostov, nathanielperson)

name: nutmeg
text: what are you doing???

name: woodenteeth
text: Hah. I went back and chubbied all the League of Gentleman references. And just to be a pedant it's "You wanna buy some pegs Daaaaave". I can't imagine anyone here not liking that series.

name: zem
text:
this is why you don't quote things that aren't meaningful or interesting out of context

more people need to learn this

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by saddestking, Doc_Rostov, tellumo)

name: apricotta
text:
Um, no.
That's the way the French do.

name: trollcollins
text: Yes! Good ol' Gallic arrogance! Classical British are also allowed to be obscure, but they must seem vaguely embarrassed about it, and not revel in having revealed how uncultured everyone else in the conversation is (even if they do take secret pleasure in it).

name: cagliostro
text: Um, I've given you a chubby for that, but I'm worried I may have been rather forthright in doing so. iure perhorrui late conspicuum tollere verticem and all that. Oh dear, I suppose that's not really quite the thing to say on here, is it? I'm terribly sorry, old man, I always misjudge these things.

name: zem
text: denise are you crappin

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Who wants to know?

name: sex_bicycle
text: YOU'RE MY WIFE NOW DAVE!! papa has to be the scariest fictional character i've ever seen tbh >.< i'm terrified of someone coming to the door one day trying to sell me clothes pegs and making me their wife :(

name: aaron_haynes
text: There's that kind of Goofy/Pluto dynamic going on here with the idea of talking bipedal cats owning such as a basic dog.

name: centipede_damascus
text:
Beef seems to have a habit of imagining himself married to various women.

I wonder if he and Molly will ever tie the knot.

name: odei
text: Apparently so.

name: estutius
text: never

name: semiquaver
text: That was a yes.

name: greymantledwolf
text: delicious.

name: stevepants
text: but i am down

name: byronic
text:
As I've aged, I find that I to have developed a thing for corpulent women.

Luscious hams, so, so many luscious hams.

name: rowboat
text: I used to think I was developing such a Thing. But then I realized it was only with clothes on, so it didn't really pan out. I can't say I'm heartbroken over it.

name: panthera3000
text: Denise

name: aarongstock
text: I have Beef's internal monologue twinned with Beck's "Debra".

name: miku224
text: This comment needs more chubbies.

name: chomopomomofo
text: This would be my family if the last panel would scroll down so we could confirm wether or not Beef is wearing pants (hint: i am very familiar with my dad's inner thighs)

name: joebot
text: Wait, what?

name: biznart
text: I can't decide if "I know my dad's inner thighs like the back of my hand" would have been a better or worse way to phrase that.

name: tomsonlocal
text: You can read a lot into the name Denise.

name: tekende
text: Denise is my mom's name. I'm not sure how I feel about this strip.

name: denise
text: it feels wierd

name: lawbot
text: May I feel your weird?

name: lawbot
text: Talk to Eliza about it.

name: johnnybaverage
text: Denise is also my mother's name. I doubt we're related, though, unless there's something Mom isn't telling me.

name: skoora
text:
Apparently, after 10 years, Beef gets punctuation.

Maybe it was Denise's luscious hams that did it.

name: laikalost
text: Considering there's a KFC, a 7-11, Jazz music, a 5.99 burger basket meal, and a free car (a 1982 suburu brat, granted) this depiction of Hell doesn't seem too... hellish.  However, this is my first time reading this comic, so I'm anxiously waiting to see what else Hell has in store for these two.

name: tourach3
text:
it wouldn't be so great for me,
i can't drive stick

name: blahhhhhhh
text: don't forget Robert Johnson plays every damn evening!

name: trollcollins
text:
See, you have to realize that Hell is eternal (unless you know about the Friendlys Menu trick, of course).

Those things are OK and maybe even kind-of-ironically fun for a weekend.

But just try 938479324749 years of them. Torture !

name: drago25
text: Any strips with characters looking ahead to their future-selves are pure class

name: manvsinternet
text: I just know that somewhere out there in hell is a Little Chef.

name: lollipopsichord
text:
surprisingly, roast beef the maybe 40-ish year old cat has a pet dog.
I AM TOO LITERAL.

name: zathyr
text: Yes.  "Feed the dog" could easily be a euphemism for something else.

name: notcool
text: Now, would he be talkin about the Aibo?

name: quinlaenar
text:
There's a girl who works at my Wal Mart named Denise. And every time I walk past her, I think "Those are some luscious hams... Denise "

It has become a thing that I almost said out loud before I pondered the possible sexual harassment suit.

Also, she's like 50 and not all that to look at. Her hams are not so much luscious as saggy.

name: quinlaenar
text: And then I immediately think "DENISE ARE YOU CRAPPIN?" and laugh.

name: serious_man
text: i am craaaaaaaaappin'
